page.title: 14LITTLE GADDESDEN C.E.CHURCH
page.content: The Church of St. Peter and St. Paul stands on the outskirts of our present village, at the end of a long lane where the centre of the village used to be up until the Black Death, when only the church was left standing. The 13th Century tower is the oldest part of the church and the bellringers practise there every Tuesday evening (there are 7 bells). The activities of the church are St. Peter and St. Pauls People who meet every Friday to help raise money for church funds. The Sunday School meet in the School Hall or the Vestry at 9.30 am to sing and pray. Services are held every Holy Day and Sunday at 8 am, 9.30 am and 6.30 pm. The church is very well looked after and decorated with pretty flowers which are nicely arranged. The Church yards are also maintained beautifully.
